bioghist.p: James A. Mears is a botanist who worked at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia from 1970 to 1983. He was Chairman of the Department of Botany and was in charge of the Academy's Phytochemistry laboratory. Mears received his Ph.D. in biology from the University of Texas at Austin in 1970. His research interests included molecular evolution in plants. He also wrote and presented papers on the history of botany and systematics.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of James Mears. Materials in the collection include: incoming and outgoing correspondence; Botany department records such as reports, memos, meeting minutes, and budget documents; records related to the 1977 Galapagos-South America Expedition; and records related to other Academy business.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
